posts.post_content:
This lady isn't even unique - look at [Livonya Silone](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Livonya Silone) for another legendary landwalker that has more colour options and can survive a bolt!  
  
But then this gal has 7 power, can be in a mono-green edh, and is cheaper... yeah ok there's like a million differences. Pff. Still achingly cool though, pity that there's not as many Legendary Lands as there should be. I think the last was the [Eye of Ugin](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Eye of Ugin). I personally have never seen one in my playgroup for some reason.  
  
EDIT: I lie! I have before used [Gods' Eye, Gate to the Reikai](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Gods' Eye, Gate to the Reikai) and [Academy Ruins](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Academy Ruins)! Also seen a [Pendelhaven](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Pendelhaven) rather often.
posts.html:
This lady isn't even unique - look at Livonya Silone for another legendary landwalker that has more colour options and can survive a bolt!

But then this gal has 7 power, can be in a mono-green edh, and is cheaper... yeah ok there's like a million differences. Pff. Still achingly cool though, pity that there's not as many Legendary Lands as there should be. I think the last was the Eye of Ugin. I personally have never seen one in my playgroup for some reason.

EDIT: I lie! I have before used Gods' Eye, Gate to the Reikai and Academy Ruins! Also seen a Pendelhaven rather often.

posts.post_content:
Twenty-one commander damage to win the game.  
  
But yeah, legendary landwalk is too random, at least on MTGO. You may run across decks which use legendary lands or have games where there are no legendary lands.  
  
Being a 7/3 is pretty damn strong for a commander though. Three hits and an opponent is gone.
